alert.note: Alert for Northeastern Brooks Range (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 10 at 5:58AM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM AKDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Anaktuvuk, Nanushuk, Itkillik, Kuparuk, Atigun, Toolik and Sagavanirktok Rivers. * WHEN...Until 1000 PM AKDT Monday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 555 AM AKDT Monday,river gage reports on the Sagavanirktok River near Pump Station 3 indicates that flooding is occuring, but that the river crest has moved downstream of Sagwon. Flooding is likely along the Anaktuvuk, Nanushuk, Itkillik, Kuparuk, and Toolik Rivers as they have similar headwaters to the Atigun and Sagavanirtok Rivers. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain fell between Atigun Pass and Sagwon from Friday night through Saturday night. - The Atigun River appears to have the highest summer water level on record when it crested Sunday morning. The Sagavanirktok River Gage near Pump Station 3 crested at minor flood stage Sunday morning and has fallen since then. This high water could threaten the Dalton Highway in areas where the highway runs along the Sagavanirtok River. The high water will move out of the area by late tonight. - For Sagavanirktok River near Pump Station 3: At 5:45am the stage was 18.91 feet. Flood Stage is 20.0 feet. - Http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
